parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From a primary kar; a horn.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A dragon or huge serpent; met: Satan. Probably from an alternate form of derkomai; a fabulous kind of serpent.
